info.game_comments:
2016 Teachers Tournament final game 1.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

jeopardy_round: TELL ME SOMETHING I DON'T KNOW

(1, 1).clue: Geographically, this largest island is actually part of North America

(2, 1).clue: "Now is the Jeopardy! of our discontent"

(3, 1).clue: Ethiopia's multi-colored flag is traditionally associated with the post-flood rainbow described in this Bible book

(4, 1).clue: On many French highways, the speed limit is 130 of these per hour, 110 if it's raining

(5, 1).clue: A type of pasta, it can also mean a fop or dandy

(6, 1).clue: In 2011 Natalie Portman danced off with Best Actress for her role in this movie

(1, 2).clue: In the 1720s Daniel Defoe published a 3-volume "Tour" of this home island

(2, 2).clue: "Something is rotten in the state of Jeopardy!"

(3, 2).clue: The first kitten born via this method was named C.C. by Texas A&M researchers; some say it's for "copy cat"

(4, 2).clue: In computerese, a nybble is defined as a half of one of these

(5, 2).clue: This coarse lace work is made by weaving & knotting cords into a pattern

(6, 2).clue: Shirley Temple presented Walt Disney with a special 8-piece Academy Award honoring this 1937 release
(6, 2).correct response: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

(1, 3).clue: The cities of Padang & Bukittinggi are found on this Indonesian island

(2, 3).clue: "The quality of Jeopardy! is not strain'd"

(3, 3).clue: Seen here, the Reynolds Building in North Carolina was an inspiration for this other building that went up two years later

(4, 3).clue: Australians sometimes refer to a measure of water volume as a sydharb, the amount of water in this

(5, 3).clue: Right now, head west on Constitution Ave. & soon you'll be on its shore

(6, 3).clue: I'm just Wilde about Harry Stradling, who won a cinematography Oscar for this novel adaptation

(1, 4).clue: It's home to about 80% of Japan's people

(2, 4).clue: "It is the green-eyed Jeopardy! which doth mock the meat it feeds on"

(3, 4).clue: This planet that orbits the Sun at a mean distance of 1.5 astronomical units has a day about 40 minutes longer than ours

(4, 4).clue: In 1960 a Gillette defined the power of one of these beams by how many razor blades it could burn through

(5, 4).clue: As of 2010 U.S. airlines can't keep you sitting here for more than 3 hours

(6, 4).clue: Jessica Lange soared as Carly Marshall & landed a Best Actress Oscar for her role in this 1994 film

(1, 5).clue: Part of Canada, this fifth-largest island is mostly inhabited by Inuit

(2, 5).clue: "It is the east & Jeopardy! is the sun"

(3, 5).clue: This 11th president was Latin salutatorian in his university class of 1818

(4, 5).clue: In Ancient Egypt this unit was divided into 7 palms or 28 fingers

(5, 5).clue: This group of shrubs often has red fruit & includes smooth & poison varieties

(6, 5).clue: "How Green Was My Valley" brought this man one of his 4 Best Director Oscars

(1, 1).clue: The Fish & Wildlife Service uses this adjective for species likely to become endangered if something isn't done

(2, 1).clue: From the Greek for "devil", it adequately describes my plans for world domination

(3, 1).clue: "Troublemaker" by Leah Remini is subtitled "Surviving Hollywood and" this religious movement

(5, 1).clue: In 1934, Walter Chrysler & his VP celebrated the one millionth Plymouth to roll off the line in this city

(6, 1).clue: Alaway, from Bausch & Lomb, is for this body part

(1, 2).clue: The phenomenon of acid rain is largely caused by emissions of this industrial pollutant, SO2

(2, 2).clue: Thousands each year undertake this type of sacred expedition to Lourdes

(3, 2).clue: "Trapped Under the Sea" investigates a disaster that struck during a cleanup of the harbor of this city known as "The Hub"

(6, 2).clue: At the car wash, drive onto the conveyor belt & put the car in this gear

(1, 3).clue: An important feature of tundra, it's a layer of constantly frozen soil underground

(2, 3).clue: This synonym for "everywhere" has 10 letters, 3 of them "U"

(3, 3).clue: This book by Rachel Carson was first published in 1962 as 3 serialized articles in the New Yorker

(5, 3).clue: The 2015 shake by Xi Jinping & Ma Ying-jeou marked the first top-level contact between these two countries in 66 years

(6, 3).clue: Expecting a crash?  Put your money in this, a term for gold or silver by quantity in bars or ingots
